author: ben.mesnik
title: NFT pools for game asset swaps
description: NFTは非常に流動性が低く、トレーディングカードのような仮想アイテムを素早く交換するには、その過程でお金と時間を失う可能性が高いです。

f6_assessments.q0: This idea will become vital soon in Cardano ecosystem because it can help not just game developers but also give more benefit to players. Currently, Cardano ecosystem lack of marketplace and some utility for helping game developers, and I hope that there should have some common places that game developers can come and use instead of developing by themselves - it will spend a lot of time and energy. Therefore, this idea I think will impact strongly to our ecosystem. Moreover, their success metrics also tell that the team is concerned about what challenge given.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has a clear mission to do, we can see it in their detailed explanation about the problem and their solution that fit. They also have some detail about tech that will be used in their tool and some relevant risk that they will face off. 
But I hope that they could detail more about their work to do in the roadmap, more than just technical implementation milestones, I do want to know how they can attract games to use their tool.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team have a clear roadmap for their developer's works, and the timeline is also realistic. Their explanation about the solution is fulfilled and can help everyone to get what they will done easily. 
The only thing I want to clear here is their first 5 games that use their tools, there's no plan or budget or people for achieving that goal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer raises the problem that NFT's presently lack liquidity and propose the creation of NFT-FT pools for instant market liquidity. This is designed to build a platform for other game developers to increase the ability for NFT's to be swapped by gamers. The team plans to scale to v2 in the second half of next year dependent on funding
f6_assessments.q1: Proposers are plutus pioneers and Haskell devs but have not provided any examples of their previous work and programming skills which would be useful in assessing their abilities of pulling this off in the timeframe specified. The budget only includes the wages for two developers. It would be good to see other costs considered such as for audit or external dev consultants. Risks of code authoring and audit have not been addressed.
f6_assessments.q2: They have indicated that there will be an official code audit but this has not been accounted for in the budget. Delivery dates are defined but seem ambitious.
f6_assessments.reply: The CA mentions in both feasibility and auditability that we do not account for the audit in our budget. This was not a mistake and the funding breakdown represents exactly the work that was proposed in the proposal. It seems as if the vast majority of negatives the CA cites are based on the fact that we did not budget an audit. We realize it might not be explicitly clear that the code audit isn’t part of the proposal but, since the CA subtracted so many points for it, we don’t feel this review accurately represents the merit of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: NFT's liquidity is an important factor in blockchain games, so if it can be improved, it will be very beneficial for the ecosystem. This project provide a generalized solution for Cardano game creators to use when exploring this frontier, which is really beneficial and worth to invest in.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has relevant experience, which ensure that they have knowledge to do the job properly. They also explain well how they can do the project. The proposal include roadmap, but I think it's still general and can be more detail. However it's quite enough to visualize what they will do.
f6_assessments.q2: They demonstrate well the auditability of the project. However these goal need to have quantity number for each KPI to become more measurable.

solution: NFT-FTプールは、NFTの流動性を即座に確保するための市場を形成し、あるゲーム資産を別のゲーム資産に簡単かつ効率的に交換することができます。
experience: 私たちは、Plutus Pioneerの第一期生で、NFTとゲームに情熱を持つHaskellの開発者です。
